content: Pedestrian bridge in SingaporeThis article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Jiak Kim Bridge" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(October 2020)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* The **Jiak Kim Bridge** ([Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters): 若锦桥; [pinyin](/wiki/Pinyin): *Ruò jǐn qiáo*) is a pedestrian bridge in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). The bridge spans the [Singapore River](/wiki/Singapore_River) near [Robertson Quay](/wiki/Robertson_Quay). Constructed in 1999, it was named after [Tan Jiak Kim](/wiki/Tan_Jiak_Kim) ([Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters): 陈若锦; [pinyin](/wiki/Pinyin): *Chén Ruò Jǐn*), grandson of famous merchant and philanthropist [Tan Kim Seng](/wiki/Tan_Kim_Seng) and son of Tan Beng Swee ([Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters): 陈明水; [pinyin](/wiki/Pinyin): *Chén Míng Shuǐ*). He is also a prominent Straits-born Chinese merchant and political activist during the early 19th century. This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e This article about transport in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Jiak Kim Bridge
